alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Typhoon Warning issued October 11 at 8:50AM ChST until further notice by NWS Guam
info.description: ...TYPHOON BOLAVEN INTENSIFYING RAPIDLY WEST OF ANATAHAN... .NEW INFORMATION... The Tropical Storm Warning and Typhoon Watch for Guam are canceled as of 8 AM ChST. A Tropical Storm Warning is now in effect for Agrihan, Pagan and Alamagan. .AREAS AFFECTED... This local statement provides recommended actions for people in Guam and the Northern Marianas. .Watches/Warnings... A Typhoon Warning continues for Rota, Tinian, and Saipan. A Tropical Storm Warning is now in effect for Agrihan, Pagan and Alamagan. Please check the latest public and marine forecasts for detailed information about additional hazards. .STORM INFORMATION... At 7 AM ChST...the center of Typhoon Bolaven was located near Latitude 16.4N...Longitude 144.3E...or about 90 miles west of Anatahan, and about 130 miles northwest of Saipan. This was about 200 miles north of Guam. Storm Motion was north-northwest at 10 mph. Storm Intensity was 115 mph. .SITUATION OVERVIEW... Typhoon Bolaven is moving away from Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan. Winds will diminish as the day goes on. Alamagan, Pagan and Agrihan will likely receive minimal Tropical Storm force winds today from the edge of Typhoon Bolaven. .PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... .NEXT UPDATE... The next local statement will be issued by the National Weather Service in Tiyan around 3 PM ChST...or sooner if conditions warrant. ...Typhoon Warning remains in effect... ...PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... ...Winds... As Typhoon Bolaven exits the area, high winds will continue to diminish. Warnings will be discontinued as soon as the threat completely subsides. ...COASTAL INUNDATION AND SURF INFORMATION... The inundation threat has passed. Dangerous surf conditions with surf heights exceeding 15 feet are expected today. Hazardous surf conditions are expected to continue through at least Thursday.
info.instruction: During the storm...stay inside and away from windows. Do not venture outside when high winds are occurring or during temporary lulls as flying debris can easily...and suddenly...cause serious injury. Have a well-charged cell phone nearby...keeping network communications as open as possible for emergencies. Closely monitor NOAA weather radio or other local news outlets for official storm information. Listen for possible changes to the forecast.
